suite_name: Comic Paradox Suite – Part IV (Cosmic Edition)
description: Fourth volume of paradox detectors exploring planetary, political, and metaphysical absurdities — where hope, hubris, and cosmic irony intersect.

paradoxes.name: Rigged Hope Gambit
paradoxes.summary: Trust the words of proven deceivers because you believe you’ll out-cheat the cheaters.
paradoxes.example_quote: They lied a thousand times, but this time the PR felt sincere.
paradoxes.detected_pattern: Cycle of betrayal sustained by competitive delusion.

paradoxes.name: Entropy Management Department
paradoxes.summary: Establish bureaucratic offices to regulate thermodynamics.
paradoxes.example_quote: All citizens must submit their heat-death mitigation forms.
paradoxes.detected_pattern: Administrative hubris applied to universal laws.

paradoxes.name: Universe KPI Report
paradoxes.summary: Measure cosmic success by quarterly stellar output.
paradoxes.example_quote: Milky Way productivity down 3%; we recommend a supernova stimulus.

paradoxes.name: The Heat Death of Common Sense
paradoxes.summary: Information overload so extreme that reasoning evaporates into irony.
paradoxes.example_quote: Facts melted faster than the ice caps.
paradoxes.detected_pattern: Entropy of discourse under infinite data input.

paradoxes.name: Terraforming While On Fire
paradoxes.summary: Colonize other planets before fixing the one currently burning.
paradoxes.example_quote: Mars looks habitable—if you ignore Earth.

paradoxes.name: Simulation Escrow
paradoxes.summary: Argue about whether reality is real instead of behaving as if it matters.
paradoxes.example_quote: If we’re in a simulation, ethics are optional.
paradoxes.detected_pattern: Philosophical abstraction used to excuse apathy.

paradoxes.name: Godsourcing
paradoxes.summary: Outsource moral decision-making to divine tech support.
paradoxes.example_quote: Let the algorithm decide—it’s basically omniscient.
paradoxes.detected_pattern: Fusion of theology and automation for accountability evasion.

cosmic_recalibration_prompts: Take one deep laugh in each cardinal direction.
Imagine the universe sighing with relief every time you stop explaining it.
If the paradox still stings, upgrade to humility version 2.0.
